p: Comprehension was rated very high for both texts, with 96.9% ( n = 62) of the readers of the neutral text stating that they understood it, while 96.2% ( n = 50) of the readers of the humorous text said the same. There was only a slight difference in the appraisal of credibility: 93.8% ( n = 61) considered the neutral text to be credible and 84.3% ( n = 43) said the humorous text was credible ( Table 2).
